speaker: Agent
text: NovaNet customer care, Divya speaking. How can I help today?

speaker: Customer
text: I’m moving to a new apartment next month and I need to shift my internet connection.

speaker: Agent
text: Perfect—move requests are my specialty. I’ll verify your account first: name and current service address?

speaker: Customer
text: I’m Vikram Desai. Current address is 12A, Greenpark Society, Ahmedabad.

speaker: Agent
text: Thanks Vikram. And the new address where you’re moving?

speaker: Customer
text: It’s 804, Suncrest Towers, Ahmedabad. Moving date is March 1.

speaker: Agent
text: Got it. First step is serviceability—whether NovaNet fiber is available at the new building. I’m checking coverage…

speaker: Agent
text: Good news: Suncrest Towers is serviceable, and we already have fiber riser installed up to the 10th floor. Since you’re on the 8th floor, that’s straightforward.

speaker: Customer
text: Nice.

speaker: Agent
text: Now timing: Do you want the service active at the new place on March 1, and disconnected at the old place on March 1 as well? Some people prefer 2–3 days overlap to avoid moving-day chaos.

speaker: Customer
text: I need internet on day one. Overlap maybe 2 days.

speaker: Agent
text: Smart. We can schedule installation at the new address on Feb 28 or March 1, and keep old service active until March 2. Billing can overlap, but we can apply a move-credit for the overlapping days if it’s within 3 days.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay.

speaker: Agent
text: Equipment question: are you using NovaNet router/ONT, or your own router?

speaker: Customer
text: NovaNet router.

speaker: Agent
text: Then you have two options: (1) carry your existing router to the new place and the technician reconfigures it, or (2) request a fresh router delivery if you prefer not to transport it. Carrying is faster and avoids any shipping delays.

speaker: Customer
text: I’ll carry it.

speaker: Agent
text: Perfect. The technician will install/activate the new ONT at the new location; your existing router will plug into it. Now I’ll book an appointment. Available slots: Feb 28 10 AM–1 PM, Feb 28 2 PM–6 PM, or March 1 10 AM–1 PM.

speaker: Customer
text: Feb 28 morning.

speaker: Agent
text: Booked: Feb 28 10–1. I’ll also schedule disconnection of the old address for March 2 end-of-day.

speaker: Customer
text: Will I be without internet at the old place before March 2?

speaker: Agent
text: No. Your old service stays active until the scheduled disconnection, unless you physically remove the ONT earlier. Since you’re carrying the router only, leave the ONT at the old place until move day—then the tech can collect or you can drop it off depending on policy.

speaker: Customer
text: Wait, I have to return ONT?

speaker: Agent
text: Yes—the ONT is leased and tied to the address. The technician typically takes it during the move-out disconnection, or we schedule a pickup. For moves, we usually swap ONTs because the fiber endpoint differs.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay.

speaker: Agent
text: Any special instructions for the new place? Like, do you need the router in a specific room for work setup?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes, living room near the desk.

speaker: Agent
text: Noted. The technician can route the fiber patch neatly, but in most apartments we’ll place ONT near the main entry point. If you need it deep inside the home, there may be an extra internal wiring charge. We can discuss with the technician on-site.

speaker: Customer
text: How much extra?

speaker: Agent
text: Typically _300 to _800 depending on length and conduit feasibility. If the building has pre-laid conduits, sometimes it’s _0. I don’t want to promise a number without seeing the layout.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay.

speaker: Agent
text: I’m creating a move order: MOVE-441208. You’ll receive SMS confirmation for the Feb 28 appointment and March 2 disconnection. Also, your plan and pricing remain the same after moving.

speaker: Customer
text: Good.

speaker: Agent
text: Recap: new address verified serviceable, install booked Feb 28 10–1, old address disconnect booked March 2 end-of-day, you’ll carry router, ONT will be swapped, potential internal wiring charges if you want deeper placement. Anything else?

speaker: Customer
text: No that’s it.

speaker: Agent
text: Awesome. Moving is chaotic—at least your internet won’t be. Thanks for calling NovaNet.
